title: “Awaiting Carrier Pickup” Meaning & When to Expect Your Package

steps.title: The service carrier is picking up your package for delivery soon.
steps.content: The service carrier is picking up your package for delivery soon. The “Awaiting Carrier Pickup” tracking status means the seller packed up your item and created a shipping label. They are now simply waiting on a service carrier, like USPS, UPS, or FedEx, to pick up the package and deliver it to you. [1] X Research source When the service carrier picks up your package, you will receive a tracking update that the shipment is on its way to you.

steps.title: The tracking status typically updates every 1 to 2 days.
steps.content: The tracking status typically updates every 1 to 2 days. Your package gets scanned as it moves through the service carrier’s network to get to you. Each time it gets scanned, its tracking status updates. This usually happens every 1 to 2 days, so expect the tracking status to update from “Awaiting Carrier Pickup” soon. [2] X Research source Sometimes, packages slip through the cracks and aren’t scanned by the carrier at each checkpoint. So, it’s possible for your package to go without a tracking status update for several days.

steps.title: It can take several days for the service carrier to deliver your package.
steps.content: It can take several days for the service carrier to deliver your package. How quickly you receive your package after the service carrier picks it up depends on your location and how busy the carrier is. For instance, if your package shipped from far away or the carrier is overwhelmed with shipments, it might be several days to weeks before you get your item. Your package’s mail type also affects how quickly it gets to you. For instance, USPS First-Class Mail and UPS Ground Shipping usually deliver within 1 to 5 days while USPS Priority Mail and UPS 3 Day Select typically deliver within 3 days. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Regularly check your package’s tracking status.
steps.content: Regularly check your package’s tracking status. It’s completely normal for your package to stay at “Awaiting Carrier Pickup” for a few days, as busy shipping times and bad weather can delay the carrier from getting it. Stay updated on your package’s progress by entering its tracking number on USPS’ website , UPS’ website , or FedEx’s website . [4] X Research source Look for your shipment’s tracking number in your order confirmation email or receipt. Or, contact the seller for the tracking number.

steps.title: Contact the service carrier to ask about the package.
steps.content: Contact the service carrier to ask about the package. If it’s been several days and your package is still stuck on “Awaiting Carrier Pickup,” reach out to the service carrier’s customer service line. A customer service agent can look into the shipment’s details, find out why your package might be stuck, and help get it to you. [5] X Research source You can contact most service carriers like USPS, UPS, and FedEx via phone, email, and online chat.

steps.title: Reach out to the sender to ask about the package.
steps.content: Reach out to the sender to ask about the package. If you haven’t heard back from the service carrier and your package is still stuck, contact the seller who’s sending the package. They might have information about your package’s shipment progress or make you aware of any delays or trouble they’re experiencing in delivering your item. For instance, call or chat with the company’s customer service or email the seller directly. After speaking to the service carrier, they might recommend reaching out to the seller anyways.

steps.title: Submit a missing package claim with the service carrier.
steps.content: Submit a missing package claim with the service carrier. If your package still hasn’t gotten to you by the delivery window, fill out a missing mail form on the service carrier’s website. This opens an investigation into where your package might be and how to deliver it to you. [6] X Research source For instance, fill out a missing mail form on USPS’ website or submit a claim on UPS’ website . If your package is deemed lost or stolen, contact the seller to ask about receiving a refund or replacement order.
